title: Muhammad ibn Qasim
summary: Muhammad ibn Qasim al-Thaqafi (Arabic: محمد بن القاسم الثقفي‎, romanized: Muḥammad bin al-Qāsim al-Thaqafī; c. 695 – 715[1][2]), was an Arab military commander of the Umayyad Caliphate who led the Muslim conquest of Sind  from the last Hindu king, Raja Dahir in the battle of Aror. He was the first Muslim to have successfully captured Hindu territories and initiate the early Islamic India in 712 AD.[1]
